title: high value target
extract: United States Department of Defense definition High-Value Target (HVT) — A target the enemy commander requires for the successful completion of the mission. The loss of HVTs would be expected to seriously degrade important enemy functions throughout the friendly commander's area of interest.
extract_html: United States Department of Defense definition High-Value Target (HVT) — A target the enemy commander requires for the successful completion of the mission.
